document_data.name: Grent Grinty
document_data.mainbody:
'''Grent Grinty''' was a commoner from the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Leave. There's no room in Lord Gortash's city for the likes of you.''|Grent Grinty}}
document_data.Description: Grent was a male [[gold dwarf]] with a clean-shaven face, pale skin, and blue eyes. He wore a simple commoner's duster and a large hat.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, the city of Baldur's Gate was threatened by the encroaching army of the [[Cult of the Absolute]]. The crisis flooded the city with refugees, elevating tensions among its citizens and allowing a new power to take rulership of the cityâ€”[[Lord Gortash]]. Grent Grinty eagerly consumed the new lord's propaganda from the curbside preachers and from the pages of the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette.'' [[Augur Harxkellan]] was a Gortash loyalist whose words attracted a crowd of gawkers in the Lower City. Grent Grinty was among the loyalists in the crowd, calling Baldur's Gate Lord Gortash's city.
